verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to the bloody <WH1818> city <WH5892>! it is all full <WH4392> of lies <WH3585> and robbery <WH6563>; the prey <WH2964> departeth <WH4185> not; bloody: Heb. city of bloods

The noise <WH6963> of a whip <WH7752>, and the noise <WH6963> of the rattling <WH7494> of the wheels <WH212>, and of the pransing <WH1725> horses <WH5483>, and of the jumping <WH7540> chariots <WH4818>.

The horseman <WH6571> lifteth up <WH5927> both the bright <WH3851> sword <WH2719> and the glittering <WH1300> spear <WH2595>: and there is a multitude <WH7230> of slain <WH2491>, and a great <WH3514> number of carcases <WH6297>; and there is none end <WH7097> of their corpses <WH1472>; they stumble <WH3782> <WH3782> upon their corpses <WH1472>: the bright: Heb. the flame of the sword, and the lightning of the spear

Because of the multitude <WH7230> of the whoredoms <WH2183> of the wellfavoured <WH2896> <WH2580> harlot <WH2181>, the mistress <WH1172> of witchcrafts <WH3785>, that selleth <WH4376> nations <WH1471> through her whoredoms <WH2183>, and families <WH4940> through her witchcrafts <WH3785>.

Behold, I am against thee, saith <WH5002> the LORD <WH3068> of hosts <WH6635>; and I will discover <WH1540> thy skirts <WH7757> upon thy face <WH6440>, and I will shew <WH7200> the nations <WH1471> thy nakedness <WH4626>, and the kingdoms <WH4467> thy shame <WH7036>.
And I will cast <WH7993> abominable filth <WH8251> upon thee, and make thee vile <WH5034>, and will set <WH7760> thee as a gazingstock <WH7210>.

And it shall come to pass, that all they that look <WH7200> upon thee shall flee <WH5074> from thee, and say <WH559>, Nineveh <WH5210> is laid waste <WH7703>: who will bemoan <WH5110> her? whence <WH370> shall I seek <WH1245> comforters <WH5162> for thee?

Art thou better <WH3190> than populous <WH527> <WH528> No <WH4996>, that was situate <WH3427> among the rivers <WH2975>, that had the waters <WH4325> round about <WH5439> it, whose rampart <WH2426> was the sea <WH3220>, and her wall <WH2346> was from the sea <WH3220>? populous: or, nourishing, etc: Heb. No Amon
Ethiopia <WH3568> and Egypt <WH4714> were her strength <WH6109>, and it was infinite <WH369> <WH7097>; Put <WH6316> and Lubim <WH3864> were thy helpers <WH5833>. thy helpers: Heb. in thy help

Yet was she carried away <WH1473>, she went <WH1980> into captivity <WH7628>: her young children <WH5768> also were dashed in pieces <WH7376> at the top <WH7218> of all the streets <WH2351>: and they cast <WH3032> lots <WH1486> for her honourable men <WH3513>, and all her great men <WH1419> were bound <WH7576> in chains <WH2131>.
Thou also shalt be drunken <WH7937>: thou shalt be hid <WH5956>, thou also shalt seek <WH1245> strength <WH4581> because of the enemy <WH341>.

All thy strong holds <WH4013> shall be like fig trees <WH8384> with the firstripe figs <WH1061>: if they be shaken <WH5128>, they shall even fall <WH5307> into the mouth <WH6310> of the eater <WH398>.

Behold, thy people <WH5971> in the midst <WH7130> of thee are women <WH802>: the gates <WH8179> of thy land <WH776> shall be set wide <WH6605> open <WH6605> unto thine enemies <WH341>: the fire <WH784> shall devour <WH398> thy bars <WH1280>.

Draw <WH7579> thee waters <WH4325> for the siege <WH4692>, fortify <WH2388> thy strong holds <WH4013>: go <WH935> into clay <WH2916>, and tread <WH7429> the morter <WH2563>, make strong <WH2388> the brickkiln <WH4404>.

There shall the fire <WH784> devour <WH398> thee; the sword <WH2719> shall cut thee off <WH3772>, it shall eat thee up <WH398> like the cankerworm <WH3218>: make thyself many <WH3513> as the cankerworm <WH3218>, make thyself many <WH3513> as the locusts <WH697>.
Thou hast multiplied <WH7235> thy merchants <WH7402> above the stars <WH3556> of heaven <WH8064>: the cankerworm <WH3218> spoileth <WH6584>, and flieth away <WH5774>. spoileth: or, spreadeth himself

Thy crowned <WH4502> are as the locusts <WH697>, and thy captains <WH2951> as the great grasshoppers <WH1462>, which camp <WH2583> in the hedges <WH1448> in the cold <WH7135> day <WH3117>, but when the sun <WH8121> ariseth <WH2224> they flee away <WH5074>, and their place <WH4725> is not known <WH3045> where <WH335> they are.

Thy shepherds <WH7462> slumber <WH5123>, O king <WH4428> of Assyria <WH804>: thy nobles <WH117> shall dwell <WH7931> in the dust: thy people <WH5971> is scattered <WH6335> upon the mountains <WH2022>, and no man gathereth <WH6908> them. nobles: or, valiant ones

There is no healing <WH3545> of thy bruise <WH7667>; thy wound <WH4347> is grievous <WH2470>: all that hear <WH8085> the bruit <WH8088> of thee shall clap <WH8628> the hands <WH3709> over thee: for upon whom hath not thy wickedness <WH7451> passed <WH5674> continually <WH8548>? healing: Heb. wrinkling
